metadata.title: CVE-2015-0206 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory leak in the dtls1_buffer_record function in d1_pkt.c in OpenSSL1.0.0 before 1.0.0p and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption) by sending many duplicaterecords for the next epoch, leading to failure of replay detection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8').
